intro: Fumaria micranthifolia, commonly known as the lesser celandine, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Fumaria micranthifolia is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
